content.webTitle: Saturday Sundae: Wigan's Jordi Gómez performs Premier League trick

fields.headline: Saturday Sundae: Wigan's Jordi Gómez performs Premier League trick
fields.bodyText: MAN OF THE DAY Jordi Gómez: rattled in an out-of-character hat-trick against Reading, becoming only the third Wigan player to score three in a Premier League game. GAFFE OF THE DAY Gómez's teammate Ali al-Habsi: normally watertight, he showed all the focus of a show-boating eight-year-old in fumbling a catch over his head into his own net. RUNNER-UP Sunderland keeper Simon Mignolet. His ricket was inevitable the moment Martin O'Neill bigged him up pre-match. "He's really fantastic," said O'Neill. "Any accolades bestowed on him he really deserves." STAT OF THE DAY 18: The number of points Manchester United have won from losing positions this season – more than any other side. SLUR OF THE DAY The vidiprinter: causing a Twitter storm after claiming PFA chairman Clarke Carlisle was sent off for foul and abusive language. The Northampton defender was actually shown two yellows for two bad tackles. Carlisle: "There were no verbals at all." SHOCK OF THE DAY Inverness, a week after being picked apart in a 5-1 home mauling by Motherwell, beating Celtic 1-0 away: their first ever league win at Celtic Park. BUSIEST WEEK Reading's @seanmorrison_91: rounded off a busy few days spent reviewing breakfast cereals on Twitter (Choco porridge was "too hot in places, stodgy texture and blandish taste" in a microwave, but "Hollllyyyyy hell! Perfect consistency" on the hob) with a thumping goal at Wigan. FOX IN THE BOX Reluctant intervention of the day: an Ebbsfleet steward called on to the pitch after fox excrement was discovered mid-match against Hereford "in and around" the penalty area.
